result.execSummary:
The defendant James P Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 9/2/22 and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James P Matthews

defendant.name: Matthews, James P
defendant.address: N21 W22283 Meadow Ln, Waukesha, WI 53186

records.addlTxt:
9:51 AM Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for James P Matthews.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
FINE: $ 263.50
	
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $ 50.00 per month commencing 9/2/22.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

10:29 AM Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court.   Defendant James P Matthews did not appear.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.
Defense is waiting on an offer.
State will route to the charging DA.  Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:07 AM Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court.   Defendant James P Matthews did not appear.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.
Defense is waiting for discovery and an offer.  Defense requests a further proceedings date.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Amended to Signature Bond. Refund bond to poster.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:52 AM Defendant James P Matthews in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and victim key and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
